result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:45 AM Defendant Zakkee Irith Hill appeared by video.  Attorney Peggy Crooks Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Zakkee Irith Hill. Warrant quashed.  Atty Borsheim requested preliminary hearing be scheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

for failure to appear at the 8/4/22 return date
filed by Atty Borsheim requesting hearing to quash warrant

10:41 AM Cases called: 22CF178, 22TR2128, 22TR2129. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zakkee Irith Hill not in court.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Zakkee Irith Hill. Defendant is in Indiana where he resides. Attorney Borsheim requested a stay of warrant if issued and a zoom appearance be approved. State requested a warrant. Court authorized a warrant. State does not have the results of the blood draw at this time. Attorney Borsheim is to make arraignments with the defendant to have the warrant quashed by Zoom at a separate time. She is then to contact the Br. 3 JA. 10:45 AM
